text: Chicago Review is a literary magazine founded in 1946. It published quarterly in the Humanities Division at the University of Chicago. The magazine talks about poetry, fiction, and criticism, often works in translation and special features in double issues. Three stories published in Chicago Review have won the O. Henry Award.O Henry Winners ==References== Category:1940s establishments in Illinois Category:1946 establishments in the United States Category:Magazines published in Chicago
title: Chicago Review
